intro: Tephrosia bojeri, commonly known as the African blue pea, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. Tephrosia bojeri is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and is also used in traditional medicine. Its seeds are sometimes used as a source of protein in local diets.
